white-space.name: white-space
white-space.value: normal | pre | nowrap | pre-wrap | break-spaces | pre-line

tab-size.name: tab-size
tab-size.computedValue: the specified number or absolute length

text-align.name: text-align
text-align.value: start | end | left | right | center | justify | match-parent | justify-all

text-align-all.name: text-align-all
text-align-all.value: start | end | left | right | center | justify | match-parent
text-align-all.computedValue: keyword as specified, except for match-parent which computes as defined above

text-align-last.name: text-align-last
text-align-last.value: auto | start | end | left | right | center | justify | match-parent

text-indent.name: text-indent
text-indent.percentages: refers to block container’s own inline-axis inner size
text-indent.computedValue: computed <length-percentage> value, plus any specified keywords

<length>.prose: Specifies extra spacing in addition to the intrinsic inter-word spacing defined by the font. <percentage>.prose: Gives the amount of the indent as a percentage of the block container’s own logical width. Tests text-indent-011.xht (live test) (source) text-indent-100.xht (live test) (source) text-indent-101.xht (live test) (source) text-indent-102.xht (live test) (source) text-indent-103.xht (live test) (source) text-indent-104.xht (live test) (source) text-indent-percent-001.xht (live test) (source) Percentages must be treated as 0 for the purpose of calculating intrinsic size contributions, but are always resolved normally when performing layout. It is not recommended to use percentage indents and intrinsic sizing together.
